name: Soft Pinch Liquid Blush
about: What it is:\ Weightless, long-lasting liquid blush with up to 12-hour wear. Blends and builds beautifully for a soft, healthy flush in matte or dewy finishes...Ingredient Callouts: Free of sulfates SLS and SLES, parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, triclosan, and triclocarban, and contains less than one percent of synthetic fragrances. This product is also vegan and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: Create a pinch-perfect flush using this featherweight formula infused with long-lasting pigments that last all day. Available in matte or dewy finishes, this liquid blush blends beautifully to create soft, buildable color with a natural, second-skin finish...This product is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner...Real results:.100% said it applies easily and wears evenly.100% said the texture is silky and glides on smoothly.100% said it stays in place upon application and is comfortable to wear.97% said the color blends seamlessly.*In an independent consumer study of 32 subjects
ingredients: Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Hydrogenated Poly(C6-14 Olefin), Mica, Octyldodecanol, Ethylene/Propylene/Styrene Copolymer, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Isododecane, 1,2-Hexanediol, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Sorbitan Sesquioleate, Propylene Carbonate, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Aluminum Hydroxide, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Gardenia Florida Fruit Extract, Nelumbo Nucifera (Sacred Lotus) Flower Extract, Nymphaea Odorata Root Extract. [+/- May Contain/Peut Contenir: Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Red 7 Lake (CI 15850), Yellow 6 Lake (CI 15985), Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Yellow 5 Lake (CI 19140), Red 28 Lake (CI 45410)].
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Gently remove excess product from applicator..-Use the doe-foot applicator and place one or two dots on each cheek..-Use fingertips and gently pat into skin for a seamless finish.

reviews.review_title: Rare Beauty Soft Pinch Liquid Blush in Love Review
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I recently tried the Rare Beauty Soft Pinch Liquid Blush in the shade Love (matte terracotta), and I can confidently say it's a game-changer! The warm terracotta tone is perfect for that natural, sun-kissed flush, and it works beautifully on most skin tones.    What I loved: - Amazing pigment:  This blush is super pigmented. Seriously, one tiny dot is all you need for both cheeks. It's great because it'll last forever, but it does take some practice to get it just right.   - Blends like a dream: Once you figure out the right amount, it blends out so smoothly—whether you use your fingers, a brush, or a sponge. It leaves this really soft, natural finish that doesn't look heavy at all.   - Stays all day:I was impressed by how long it lasted. Even after a full day, it still looked fresh, which is awesome if you're not into touching up.   - Lightweight feel:It doesn't feel cakey or sticky, which I love. It's like you're not even wearing blush!    A couple of things to watch for: -  Go easy at first: Since it's super pigmented, it's easy to overdo it. Start small—you can always add more if needed!   - Applicator design: The doe-foot applicator is cute, but it can dispense more than you need, so be careful when applying.    Overall, I love this blush. It's perfect for adding warmth and a natural glow to your makeup look. It might take a little trial and error to master, but it's 100% worth it.   Would totally recommend it if you're looking for a long-lasting, easy-to-blend blush that gives you a gorgeous flush!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was gifted this product as well as a few other shades in mini size from Sephora and Rare Beauty to try out as a Sephora Beauty Insider Community Ambassador, however this is my honest review and feedback. I have four shades of this formula in varying sizes, from samples, deluxe mini's and full size.  The formula remains the same across sizes and shades in my opinion.  I found the biggest drawback of this formula is that it can be too pigmented.  I love a blush heavy look but find that even so, I need to put the product on the back of my hand, spread it out with a finger then use my blush brush to pick up product to put onto my face.  Once I get the product on it looks great and blends nicely.  It lasts about 6-8 hours on me if I don't set it with a powder blush on top, which is average for me with blush products. The biggest drawback for me with this product is that when I try to apply it directly to my face, it's VERY easy to end up with too much product or if I use a very very tiny dot it takes forever to blend out.  This leaves me with smearing it on the back of my hand first.  For me, this is just an extra step that other blushes don't need.  I also wonder how long it would take someone to fully use up one of the full size products with daily use?  The smaller mini sizes I have think would last way longer necessary.

reviews.review_text: Love this blush! A little goes a VERY long way! In fact, I can't imagine EVER finishing a bottle even with daily use. Make sure to wipe the excess off of the wand before applying. I recommend letting it sit on your skin a few moments to warm the product to your skins temperature - this makes a huge difference in blending it out for a natural look. If you find that you've used too much, use a dry fluffy brush and dab over it until it has muted to your preference. I find joy to be super flattering. Not too pink, not too orange, not too dark. It looks very natural - like coming back from vacation with a sunny glow. You know when you've been smiling a lot and the shade of your cheeks is rosy and looks so healthy? This is THAT in a bottle.

reviews.review_text: Rare Beauty's blushes are a true standout in the beauty world, offering a range of shades that work beautifully for both warm and cool undertones. The formula is lightweight, buildable, and blends effortlessly into the skin, giving a natural flush of color without feeling heavy or cakey.  For those with warm undertones, the blushes in shades like Love (a soft pink) or Joy (a bright, warm coral) create a vibrant, sun-kissed look. On the other hand, cool-toned beauties will adore shades like Grateful (a deep rose) or Nearly Mauve (a cool, dusty pink), which provide a soft, romantic flush that complements cooler skin tones perfectly.  What sets Rare Beauty apart is its inclusivity—no matter your undertone, there's a shade that will suit you.

reviews.review_title: Very pigmented and easy to blend, does fade though
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The pigmentation is definitely there, as you may have seen all of the videos using this. I first got Soft Pinch Luminous Powder Blush in Happy and it was the perfect cool pink for me, but I feel that the liquid blush in Happy leans a touch warmer, however, it still sheers out quite beautifully on my cool pale skin. The liquid blush does not seem to last very long though. Using the powder blush as a topper might help to improve the longevity, but there are certain areas I'd rather not use the Rare Beauty powder blush on because of its highlighting properties. Overall though, I do love this product; it's very easy to blend, lots of color payoff, and sheers out to a very natural-looking blush so as long as you use a light hand.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I honestly don't really know what to say about these that hasn't been said already. For as much hype that these get I must say that these are 110% worth the hype. The packaging is beautiful and easy to access, you get a great amount of product in each component, and the formula is to die for. I currently have shades Happy, Grateful, and Lucky, which I each love for different reasons. Happy is a great everyday pink shade, Grateful is a natural looking true red that can also be used to create a fiery statement color, and Lucky is an absolutely stunning bright fuchsia. And let me say that the pigment for all of these...unmatched. It's not the hardest thing in the world to make a pigmented liquid blush, but it is hard to make a SUPER pigmented liquid blush that also happens to be lightweight and easy to blend...and that's these. These are so pigmented I don't ever think I'll have to repurchase because you really don't have to use very much, especially for the super pigmented shades like Lucky. I can see how for some people that might be an issue if they want a more sheer blush look, but I achieve that by placing the blush on the hand/wrist first and then blending it into the cheeks with a sponge (or a brush, if I want more pigment). These are so so so worth the hype and I can't say enough good things about this product. If you haven't tried these yet, and you love a pigmented liquid blush, run, don't walk!!
